action_card_access_bp1: Updates automatically transfer across any related applications.
action_card_access_bp2: Create up to 300 groups, or reach out to your account team to request an increase.
action_card_description: Configure groups that include your identity provider groups, IP, device, certificates, or service tokens. Reuse groups across Access Applications.
action_card_user_bp1: Create a group of employees, IP addresses, or countries.
action_card_user_bp2: Access Groups cannot be used in Gateway policies.
config_assigned_apps_description: The group settings above are applied to the applications below
config_cancel_msg: You will lose any changes made to this group.
config_default_card_description: Apply this rule group to new applications by default. This selection will replace any existing default group. Updating your default group will not affect existing application policies.
config_description: Create a new rule group to use across multiple Access applications. With groups, you can grant or restrict user access to your applications.
config_error_name_over_max_limit_letters: Name must be shorter than %{limitExclusive} characters
config_failed_create_unknown: Failed to create with unknown error.
config_failed_update_unknown: Failed to update with unknown error.
delete_desc: Are you sure you want to delete this group?
description: Create a group to use in Access policies for self-hosted and SaaS applications. Groups can contain a mix of users, identity provider groups, and more options like service tokens, device posture, and IP addresses.
docs_description: Access Groups allow you to define a set of users to which an application policy can be applied. You can reuse Access groups to quickly create policies that apply to the same set of users.
empty_state_description: Groups are helpful when you need to create multiple policies and apply them to a recurring set of users. Defining those users in a group speeds up your policy creation process.
empty_state_more_info: If you need help, here’s our <0>documentation</0> about groups.
group_config_description: Build rules to determine membership of this group. Your group must contain at least one Include rule.
groups_empty_description: Add groups and see them appear here.
groups_limit_reached:
You've reached the maximum
number of groups allowed.
<0>Learn more
groups_limit_reached_no_break: You've reached the maximum number of groups allowed. <0>Learn more</0>
please_add_a_rule_to_group: Please add at least one rule to the group.
recommendation_groups_description: Apply groups to your Access Application policies. Access supports self-hosted, SaaS and private network applications.
recommendation_warp_description: Download WARP on user devices to connect to Cloudflare’s network and enforce WARP-based group criteria.
rule_invalid_error: There is an error with one or more of your rules. Check your group configuration and try again.
table_description: Manage the configurations of your existing groups and set a default group.
title: Access groups
